message_1: Find all the quadratic residues of 19.
message_2:
A quadratic residue modulo an odd prime p is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo p. In other words, a number x is a quadratic residue modulo p if there exists an integer y such that x ≡ y^2 (mod p).

To find all the quadratic residues of 19, we can calculate the squares of the integers from 1 to (p-1)/2, which is 1 to 9 in this case, and then reduce them modulo 19.

1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 19)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 19)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 19)
4^2 ≡ 16 (mod 19)
5^2 ≡ 25 ≡ 6 (mod 19)
6^2 ≡ 36 ≡ 17 (mod 19)
7^2 ≡ 49 ≡ 11 (mod 19)
8^2 ≡ 64 ≡ 7 (mod 19)
9^2 ≡ 81 ≡ 5 (mod 19)

So, the quadratic residues of 19 are {1, 4, 9, 16, 6, 17, 11, 7, 5}.
